content.raw: Is this line correct? What if you have stored one single watcher with the requested `topic` but a different type. The expected behavior should be to keep the original watcher but I believe this line will cause the watcher to be deleted.
content.html: Is this line correct? What if you have stored one single watcher with the requested topic but a different type. The expected behavior should be to keep the original watcher but I believe this line will cause the watcher to be deleted.

update.description:
The new method ```bool Node::WaitForSubscribers(const std::string &_topic, const int _timeout = -1);``` is added. New classes ```TopicWatcher```, ```TopicWatcherPrivate```, ```TopicWatcherStorage``` were added to provide the opportunity to use this function.

In the ```NodeShared``` class there is  ```TopicWatcherStorage```. The data is a map where the keys are topics, the values are another map, where the key is nuuid, the value is shared_ptr<TopicWatcher>.

We could check ```NodeShared::localSubscriptions``` and ```NodeShared::remoteSubscribers``` first. Then if there is no subscriptions we create a topic watcher and call ```wait```.
update.title: Issue_47: Wait for subscribers

content.raw: I agree with you. Here is [[d72b690](https://bitbucket.org/nampi/ign-transport/commits/d72b6901a0b55b593b53a7a728a9be1f2c12f13f?at=default)] you can see an update. I add ```msgTypeName``` in ```NodeShared::OnNewConnection()```. I should add a message type in ```bool Node::Unsubscribe(const std::string &_topic)``` to send a message. But I don't have a message type in ```Unsubscribe```. I add ```std::string msgTypeName = "ignition::msgs::Empty";``` but I am not sure that it is the best way. Could you review this part of code in ```bool Node::Unsubscribe(const std::string &_topic)```, please?
content.html: I agree with you. Here is [d72b690] you can see an update. I add msgTypeName in NodeShared::OnNewConnection(). I should add a message type in bool Node::Unsubscribe(const std::string &_topic) to send a message. But I don't have a message type in Unsubscribe. I add std::string msgTypeName = "ignition::msgs::Empty"; but I am not sure that it is the best way. Could you review this part of code in bool Node::Unsubscribe(const std::string &_topic), please?

In the ```NodeShared``` class there is  ```TopicWatcherStorage```. The data is a map where the keys are topics, the values are another map, where the key is nuuid, the value is shared_ptr<TopicWatcher>.

We could check ```NodeShared::localSubscriptions``` and ```NodeShared::remoteSubscribers``` first. Then if there is no subscriptions we create a topic watcher and call ```wait```.

content.raw: Shouldn't `NotifyTopicWatcher()` accept the topic type too?

Shouldn't we check if the type matches `_typeName` too? Maybe we don't have that information right now and we have to include the type in the message sent from `NodeShared::OnNewConnection()` to the control socket. In `NodeShared::RecvControlUpdate()` we are initializing the publisher with an empty type. We probably should read the new type and add it to the publisher.
content.html: Shouldn't we check if the type matches _typeName too? Maybe we don't have that information right now and we have to include the type in the message sent from NodeShared::OnNewConnection() to the control socket. In NodeShared::RecvControlUpdate() we are initializing the publisher with an empty type. We probably should read the new type and add it to the publisher.

content.raw: Could you clarify that this method requires that the same node advertises a topic before?
content.html: Could you clarify that this method requires that the same node advertises a topic before?

content.raw:
Isn't the entire body equivalent to:

`return (this->data.erase(_topic) > 0);`?
if the node has a watcher registered waiting on the specified topic.
content.html: if the node has a watcher registered waiting on the specified topic.
